component.text: Verify VTP Clients Have Received the New VLAN Information
Attempt to Configure VLAN on a Client

component.feedback: ***You must enter the exact and full command. Commands that include a name or password are case-sensitive.***
component.existingcommands: Display the current VTP settings on S1.

command.deviceresponse:
VTP Version capable : 1 to 3
VTP version running : 1
VTP Domain Name :
VTP Pruning Mode : Disabled
VTP Traps Generation : Disabled
Device ID : 0cd9.96e8.8a00
Configuration last modified by 0.0.0.0 at 0-0-00 00:00:00

Feature VLAN:
--------------
VTP Operating Mode : Transparent
Maximum VLANs supported locally : 255
Number of existing VLANs : 5
Configuration Revision : 0
MD5 digest : 0x57 0xCD 0x40 0x65 0x63 0x59 0x47 0xBD
0x56 0x9D 0x4A 0x3E 0xA5 0x69 0x35 0xBC
S1#
command.instruction:
Enter Global Configuration mode on S1 then issue the following commands:
  • Configure S1 as the VTP server.
  • Configure VTP with CCNA as the domain name.
  • Set the VTP password to cisco12345
  • Exit Global Configuration mode.
  • Display the VTP password for verification.
  • Display the VTP settings to verify the other changes to VTP.

command.deviceresponse:
S1(config)#
*Mar 1 00:06:13.108: %SW_VLAN-6-VTP_DOMAIN_NAME_CHG: VTP domain name changed to CCNA.

S1(config)#
Setting device VTP password to cisco12345

VTP Traps Generation : Disabled

command.instruction: <font face="_sans"><b>You have successfully configured and verified VTP.</font>
